meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of The Gambia.
meanings.sent1: In The Gambia, you can buy many things with just one dalasi.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for dalasi when I visited The Gambia.
meanings.sent3: The dalasi in my pocket seemed to whisper, 'Spend me wisely.'
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a thousand dalasi.
meanings.sent5: The shiny dalasi coin gleamed in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in The Gambia.
meanings.sent1: The market vendor accepted dalasi for the fruits I bought.
meanings.sent2: I needed to withdraw some dalasi from the ATM for the trip.
meanings.sent3: The dalasi rolled off the table and into the piggy bank with a clatter.
meanings.sent4: His words carried more weight than any amount of dalasi.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked bread filled the air as I paid with dalasi.
